data.message: So FB, you said no need to sign up but did say "once activated".  How do we activate it.

replies.message: Hi Linda. There are a number of factors we'll take into consideration when deciding whether or not to activate Safety Check. We will focus primarily on the scope and impact of the event and we will rely on trusted sources, like government agencies and disaster organizations and experts, to help us get the information we need to make this decision. -Hailey
Oh ok...so nothing to do on my end?
And no response to Linda's response?
Sounds like it's automatic which is fine with me. I think it's worthwhile. FB is always thinkin
Hmm just sounds like another way of tracking a persons movements to me.
It's not another way to track someone. It's a way to use the information they already have from tracking us.
Their tracking us anyway, finally something we can benefit from.

I think its a great idea to help locate family and friends..Just like the Amber alert on Monday I was st my Doctors office register in. When my phone went on and everyone s phone went on it was amazing..thank you Facebook I want to be tracked down in the event of Disaster and kmow my family and friends are O K.
Its active now...but it only goes on in a disaster/emergency. You don't need to do anything... If you have Facebook.. You are all set
Gonna rely on Government sources and FEMA ? You mean like they did in Katrina ?
It still won't help if u have a tornado in ur small.community and the disaster isn't large enuf for government agencies to be involved so u still need  a family plan in place for disaster events.
